overview: This subject, together with EDUC90334 Minor Project in Education 2, comprises the Capstone experience for Stream B (non-placement pathway) of the Master of Learning Intervention. Drawing on theory, knowledge and skills developed throughout the Master of Learning Intervention, students will complete a critical literature review focused on a research topic related to their individual specialisation of disability, learning difficulties or deaf education.

necessary pre-requisite: Completion of a minimum of 50 credit points of study
additional pre-requisite: Admission into the MC-LI Master of Learning Intervention

assessments.description: A literature review examining an educational issue in disability, learning difficulties and/or deaf education. 4000 words

Attendance. Hurdle requirement:. A minimum of 75% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

Semester 1 (Extended) - Online.Contact hours: 24 hours: 10 hours of seminars and 14 hours of asynchronous activity

Semester 1 (Extended) - Online.Pre teaching requirements: During the pre-teaching period, students will be expected to engage with materials posted on the LMS.

Semester 2 (Extended) - Online.Contact hours: 24 hours: 10 hours of seminars and 14 hours of asynchronous activity

Semester 2 (Extended) - Online.Pre teaching requirements: During the pre-teaching period, students will be expected to engage with materials posted on the LMS.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
